clinical_study.brief_title: Cardio-Respiratory Response of a Training Session Versus an Adapted Physical Activity Session
clinical_study.official_title: Cardio-Respiratory Response of an Exercise Training Session With Ergocycle or Treadmill Compared to an Adapted Physical Activity Session on a Wii, in Patients With Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: the aim of this study is to show that training session with nintendo WII requires the same cardiorespiratory demand than training session on ergocycle or treadmill, traditionally used in pulmonary rehabilitation program.

primary_outcome.measure: compare heart rate between a training session on cycle or treadmill and a training session on Nintendo WII
primary_outcome.description: heart rate (pulse per minute) at the end of each session

secondary_outcome.measure: compare dyspnea between a training session on cycle or treadmill and a training session on nintendo WII
secondary_outcome.description: dyspnea (borg scale) at the end of each session

secondary_outcome.measure: compare lower limb muscle fatigue between a training session on cycle or treadmill and a training session on nintendo WII
secondary_outcome.description: lower limb muscle fatigue (borg scale) at the end of each session

secondary_outcome.measure: compare pulse oxymetry (SpO2) between a training session on cycle or treadmill and a training session on nintendo WII
secondary_outcome.description: SpO2 at the end of each session

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the felt pleasure between a training session on cycle or treadmill and a training session on nintendo WII
secondary_outcome.description: felt pleasure (likert scale) at the end of each session

study_pop.textblock: patients with pulmonary disease admitted in pulmonary rehabilitation unit of CHU Brest

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with pulmonary disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- exacerbation of the pulmonary disease
- Weight >150Kg
- Refusal to participate
- People in pre and post surgical rehabilitation
